title: Buy Sonos Instead. *updated*
text:
The app works fine, the speakers are junk, unless you're looking for a very expensive iPhone speaker that you connect with Bluetooth and then leave your iPhone lying right beside. In spite of what the makers say, you can *not* play different things on different speakers (unless you have a separate iPhone for each speaker), and you can *not* play things that are on your computers that share the wifi connection with the speakers. You can play what's on your iPhone, and you can use your spotify account. That is all. The Bluetooth connection is so weak that the iPhone must be in the same room with the speaker. 
If you have any questions or need help, don't waste your time with customer support,  you will not be acknowledged in any way. 
We bought these because they seemed, from the makers' representation, a decent and less expensive substitute for our Sonos system, which we love and which performs excellently but is more pricey. After dealing with these, we will gladly be buying Sonos and never look at these again.

There are lots of Bluetooth speakers out there. The reason I am dissatisfied is that I bought what purported to be a wifi speaker and it only performs as a Bluetooth speaker. I realize that operator error is a common cause for this type of complaint but I am decently tech savvy and this is the only wifi device in my home that fails to function adequately. 

If anything changes and these begin to do what they are marketed to do or if I discover what I am doing wrong, I will update this review with apologies to the makers. For now, I am a disgruntled customer who is saving my pennies for a trustworthy Sonos.

title: Poor Music Service Support
